1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

2.brief: to say (used with great latitude)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))

a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money

broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
